wikipedia_page.main: Edward Thwaites (4 October 1801 at Staplehurst, Kent  18 January 1872 in Hastings, Sussex) was an English professional cricketer who played first-class cricket from 1825 to 1837.  He was mainly associated with Kent and Sussex.  He made 25 known appearances in first-class matches including 1 for the Players in 1827.

Edward Thwaites (Thwaytes) (baptised 1661–1711) was an English scholar of the Anglo-Saxon language. According to David C. Douglas he was "one of the most inspiring teachers which Oxford has ever produced".David C. Douglas, English Scholars (1939), p. 79.
